2015-01-14 at 15:17 by Sascha Penzhorn – Kristoffer Jelbring from Mojang gave a small preview of the upcoming feature to change the profile name in Minecraft on 01/05/15 on Twitter. In and of itself not an earth-shattering feature, but this function has been requested since the alpha in mid-2009 and has not yet been implemented.

Update 01/14/15: Only a few more weeks and you can finally change your username in Minecraft. According to an FAQ on Mojang.com, the change is possible free of charge from 2/4/15. 37 days after you changed the name, the original one will be shared with other users. Until then, you have the opportunity to undo the name change if you like your old one better. For more answers to pressing questions, visit the Minecraft Name Change FAQ.

N / A? Tired of running around as Twerkboy69 in Minecraft? The option to change profile names in Minecraft is coming soon. There is no exact date for this feature at the moment, but it will not appear before Update 1.8. Mojang’s Kristoffer Jelbring posted an image on Twitter as a teaser for the name change. A few minutes later, he had to explain to fans that “Minecraft name change” didn’t mean that the name of the game should change.

No we’re not changing the name of the game. I’m talking about IGN changes. Would’ve thought that was obvious 😛

— Kristoffer Jelbring (@KrisJelbring) January 6, 2015

Minecraft Caves and Cliffs Update: Part 2 in the official trailer

Microsoft has released a new trailer to coincide with the release of the second part of Minecraft Caves & Cliffs. Minecraft 1.18, part 2 of the Caves & Cliffs update announced last year, will be released on November 30th for the Java and Bedrock editions.

Name changes are free – however, your profile is only allowed a limited number of name changes within a set period of time. So you can’t change your name every five minutes as you please, but you have to wait a little after changes before you can make the next name change. As soon as there are more details, you will find out on our Minecraft topic page.
